sub_title: Adviseur Gezondheidsbevordering bij GGD Noord- en Oost-Gelderland
summary:
I’m passionate about coordinating public health programs with a direct societal relevance, in collaboration with practice stakeholders. 

My work on evaluating several health/lifestyle interventions focused on children, adults and older adults has provided me with ample experience in designing and coordinating studies on implementation and effectiveness, collecting and analyzing mixed-method data, collaborating with various stakeholders and participants, and managing multidisciplinary research teams. 

I have a pro-active nature, a structured way of working, perseverance, and a desire to learn and improve. It is my ambition to use my coordination, planning, communication, and collaboration skills for health-related projects.

awards.title: NAV Publicatieprijs 2020-2021
awards.description: Ik heb de NAV Publicatieprijs 2020-2021 gewonnen met het artikel "Effectiveness of a Diet and Resistance Exercise Intervention on Muscle Health in Older Adults: ProMuscle in Practice", gepubliceerd in JAMDA. De jury zegt: "Dit artikel is een goed uitgevoerde gerandomiseerde studie naar het effect van een multi-component interventie op spiergezondheid bij ouderen. De studie laat zien hoe verlies van spierfunctie bij ouderen in de praktijk aangepakt zou kunnen worden."

publications.name: Process Evaluation of a Combined Lifestyle Intervention for Community-Dwelling Older Adults: ProMuscle in Practice

profile_positions.description: As a health promotion advisor I advice municipalities and organizations on the topics healthy ageing, smoking, and overweight (Combined Lifestyle Intervention SLIMMER).
profile_positions.title: Health Promotion Advisor

company.name: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health

profile_positions.company: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health
profile_positions.description: Worked on several projects in the Department of International Health (Division of Human Nutrition), in the group of prof. Gittelsohn. Topics included obesity prevention in Native American populations and digital strategies for improving the food environment in Baltimore City. (volunteer position due to COVID-19)
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
- Coordinated the optimization and dissemination of the combined lifestyle intervention for older adults 'ProMuscle in Practice' within several practice organisations. I've designed tools to monitor implementation and effectiveness.
- Literature studies on a variety of nutrition related topics
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Studying implementation and effectiveness of an adapted efficacious intervention, combining resistance exercise and nutrition for elderly people, in a multicenter RCT in a real-life setting. 
PhD thesis title: 'Dietary protein and resistance exercise training for community-dwelling older adults. Intervention adaptation, implementation and effectiveness'

Accomplishments:
•	Systematically adapted a combined diet and exercise intervention for the Dutch healthcare real-life setting using Intervention Mapping. 
•	Developed implementation manuals for healthcare professionals.
•	Performed a pilot study for this intervention in 25 older adults, collaborating with a care organization and industrial partner. Aim: evaluate intervention feasibility. 
•	Designed and coordinated a randomized controlled trial with 168 older adults in five municipalities in the Netherlands. Aim: evaluate effectiveness and implementation of the “ProMuscle in Practice” intervention, using mixed-methods.
•	Coordinated the research team consisting of ~10 students and research assistants. 
•	Collaborated with stakeholders (care organizations, food industry, municipality health service, municipalities, and exercise providers).
•	Created two study protocols for approval by Medical Ethics Review committee (IRB). 
•	Collaborated with Radboud University (Nijmegen, the Netherlands) in cross-sectional research, resulting in a publication.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate 'ProMuscle in Practice'

profile_positions.description: This Junior Researcher position, in which I adapted a clinical intervention to real-life setting and performed a pilot study, was eventually part of my PhD research. The accomplishments of this work are described as part of my PhD Candidate work above.
profile_positions.title: Junior Researcher "ProMuscle in Practice"

profile_positions.description: Coordinator of the WU MSc course 'Public Health Nutrition: Development of Nutrition Intervention Programmes' (6 ects).
profile_positions.title: MSc Course Coordinator 'Public Health Nutrition'

profile_positions.description: The Smaaklessen vegetable menu study aims to study the effects of nutrition education on Dutch primary schools. I coordinated the recruitment of schools, and I was responsible for the preparation and organisation of the measurements (maternity leave cover). I instructed and guided the team of 6 students that performed the measurements. The study was performed in March and April 2014.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant 'Taste Lessons' vegetable menu study

profile_positions.description: I coordinated and guided the effect measurements of approximately 200 adult participants of the SLIMMER study. SLIMMER is a lifestyle intervention for adults with an increased risk of diabetes type 2.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant for SLIMMER diabetes prevention project

profile_positions.description: Collect data from primary school students and teachers, analyse data (partly using Multilevel Analysis), co-author of the final report.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant for Effect evaluation of 'Smaaklessen'

profile_positions.location: Chairgroup of Communication at Wageningen University
profile_positions.description:
Aim: Obtain insight in behavioural determinants of university freshmen students' sport behaviour. 

Activities: Independently designed and performed research. Literature study to form explanatory model with behavioural determinants for student sport behaviour. Collect (cross-sectional) data from freshmen students using an online survey. Analyse quantitative data using SPSS and report findings in thesis report.

Results: An extensive overview of freshmen students' behavioural determinants on sport behaviour. Habits seemed to be important for student sport practice. Strong self-regulatory skills during adolescence were beneficial for sports practice after transition to university.
profile_positions.title: Minor MSc Thesis on Behavioural determinants of university freshmen student's sport behaviour

profile_positions.description: I assisted in development of an interview guide for interviews with experts on nutrition, malnutrition and elderly people. I also helped with transcribing and coding the interviews. PRIMA maaltijd aims to develop protein-enriched meal concepts for in-home assisted elderly people.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant PRIMA maaltijd project

profile_positions.description: Ik was cassière en barmedewerker in dit kleine filmtheater.
profile_positions.title: Cashier

profile_positions.description:
This project is part of the effect evaluation of 'Smaaklessen' (in English: taste lessons). Smaaklessen is a curriculum for Dutch primary schools, to increase awareness in children about taste, food & health and food sustainability. 

Aim: Create an overview of Smaaklessen implementation at primary schools. Study the association between implementation and the short-term effect of Smaaklessen on child behavioural determinants. 

Activities: Collect data from children and teachers at Dutch primary schools. Perform data-analysis to obtain descriptive statistics of implementation and to link the implementation to the change in behavioural determinants. Report the findings in a Dutch report. 

Results: A clear overview of Smaaklessen implementation, covering the dosis, appreciation of teachers and students, and contextual factors. Furthermore, interesting relations between implementation and change in behavioural determinants were found.
profile_positions.title: Internship at Smaaklessen / WUR

profile_positions.location: Wageningen University and GGD-NOG (previously GGD Gelre-IJssel)
profile_positions.description:
Aim: To develop and validate effect-evaluation questionnaires for children and parents for overweight intervention course 'Evenwicht' of GGD Gelre-IJssel (community health service).

Activities: Combine evidence-based and practice-based knowledge on behaviour (and behavioural determinant) change in relation to overweight to develop practical questionnaires. Discussion with course leaders (dieticians and youth nurses) to obtain clear overview of the intervention. Pre-test and validate questionnaires. 

Results: Practical and internal reliable questionnaires were developed, founded by research and practice and highly specific for course Evenwicht.

http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs12508-014-0089-9
profile_positions.title: MSc Thesis: Development & validation of effect-evaluation questionnaires for overweight intervention
